website_summaries.verdict: With the ability to rapidly warm your pool and energy-efficient operation, this is one of the best pool heaters available.
pros: This gas-powered model has a 55,000-BTU output to rapidly heat your pool
Can support pools of up to 10,000 gallons
The narrow design is easy to fit in a variety of spaces
Thanks to the titanium heat exchanger, this is a durable model that will last for years
cons: Many customers received units that were damaged in shipping

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm. Hookup was easy. I had a service panel with 230 available, so wiring was easy. Plumbed it in. Hit the on button, the contactor came in starting the pump and heating started. On the down side. Customer service stinks. No email was ever answered.
customer_reviews.author: Winona

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say it hasn't broken because as soon as I do it will break! Lol! But seriously it has been great so far. We bought it and had it up and running in April. If you dont know what you're doing you WILL need to hire a professional! Read the fine print before purchase. It is NOT a "plug and play" unit. It doesn't even come with a power cord. You need to hardwire one. You also need to make sure you have the appropriate voltage to plug into, you need 220. Beyond that it's been a great heater so far!
customer_reviews.author: Holly7

customer_reviews.title: good value. NOTE
customer_reviews.text: All positive, good value. NOTE: Don't push the upper intake pipe all the way in, this will block the flow and the unit will not turn on. I called the seller and he told me to back the pipe out 3/4 inch. I did and it worked. This should be part of the instructions. P
customer_reviews.author: Percy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but meant for small pools
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these, but I ended up sending it back as it was too small for my 8,000 gallon pool and hot tub. But if it was just for keeping the pool warm, it would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Gum

customer_reviews.title: Heater is good, control panel kinda sucks.
customer_reviews.text: The heater works great, and I've already recommended it to several of my friends. Installing was straight forward, just follow the instructions and recognize you're working with 220. My only complaint is that the little cover for the control panel broke by just lifting it up on the second day. Now I have to gently sit it back on the hinge everytime I look at the panel which is super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: M. Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but I think it was damaged before packageing
customer_reviews.text: I really like the unit. I received it the carton was perfect but the unit had a huge dent on the frame and the other end was dented but did not effect the fins. I cannot beleive the box can be perfect with this damage inside I think it was repackaged and sent to me like this. I am very fortunate that I have found no problems with the unit working correctly. Also I live in Guatemala and a friend brought it down to me in the back of a Suburban and he inspected it when he picked it up. also after ordering it it was a one and a half months before I received it. Hope this helps you.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Cavins

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in shipping
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews this seemed like it would be a decent quality heater at a reasonable price. Maybe it would be, but the one I received was seriously damaged in shipping. The panel with the plumping and electrical connections was smashed and the gauge glass was broken. I called the Fibropool customer service number and it rang for a long time. When voicemail finally picked up I couldn’t understand the message. I decided to send it back. That part went well. Not sure if I’ll try to order one again
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not the best solution but it is still working
customer_reviews.text: At first the all the washers were not delivered with the unit however they did come the next day and the professional instillation was completed. One issue is the output line kept pushing out. We had to take one of the rubber pieces and zip tie it to one pipe to prevent this. Not the best solution but it is still working. If you are looking for something to heat fast this is not the unit for you. It heats in slow increments and requires the pump to be running. I would not recommend for areas were it gets real cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installation was fairly easy, ran a 240 line out to the pool ...
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the money if you want to raise the temperature of your pool. Installation was fairly easy, ran a 240 line out to the pool with an emergency cut off and then just plumbed it with some PVC. Now the bad" While it does raise the pool temp, it's super expensive. I had no idea what to expect with this thing, figured it might bump my electric bill up by $100, I wasn't expecting a $300 increase just trying to heat the pool to 86 in new england. I, for one, will be disconnecting this and throwing it in my shed for the rest of it's life. Maybe I'll try and sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Runs quieter than my 1-3/4 HP pool pump
customer_reviews.text: This heater does the job. We are heating our 14000 gal inground pool in coastal San Diego to comfortable swimming temp. Even back in Feb when nightime temp was below freezing and daytime about 60 we got water up to 78F. Water is well into the 80's now. We installed solar photovoltaic panels with excess generating capacity so we easily run the heat pump as well as charge our electric car. Very happy with the customer service and the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my 15,000 gallon in ground at 90 degrees!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this heater!!! Delivery was a breeze, just had to help trucker get it off truck. Install was a breeze....1hr. Took pool from cold to 80+ in 48hrs. Very quiet unit. Cant say enough about the customer support. Spoke to owner several times via email. Guided me through the whole install process as a DIYer!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Kirk-Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Product works with no problems. Closing pool on sept. 27 because weather will be in 50’s this week. Wisconsin. This heater will help maintain a comfortable temperature in pool as long as the weather does not cool below 65 during the day. I also have solar cover on pool to help with temperature. I am happy with the product. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Phil f

customer_reviews.title: High efficiency
customer_reviews.text: This heater Is worth the cost - it is extremely efficient and adequately heats a small inground pool. My pool is about 9,000 gallons. The pool temperature was 59 degrees when i first installed the unit in early May in Maryland. Typically it’s way too cold to open a pool this early in this area. Within 2 days the pool temperature was 82 degrees. I’m sure it can reach a higher temp but I want to wait for the outside temperature to increase first. You will not be disappointed with this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley A. Matheu

customer_reviews.title: Only appropriate for a small pool
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't seem to be getting the pool as I hoped. After it taking several days to go from 72 to 79 in Florida I did some research after I became concerned. 55k btu is small for a 9000 gallon pool. Generally heaters go from 100k to 200k. I may have to give up on this unit
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product and way cheaper then others.
customer_reviews.text: I normally don’t write reviews but this was worth writing a review about. I live on the central coast of California where temps are between 40-50 at night and 70-90- during the day. Our pool with a solar cover stays around 60-65 most of the year. I got and electrician to hook it up (I did the pipes) and in 2 days we have 85 degree water. Now we can use the pool a majority of the year and the kids are loving it. I have a smaller in ground pool at 7500 gallons.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Customer Service / Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great experience, Customer service is the best. We had problems setting the heater up and he was more than willing to walk us through everything we needed. I can't recommend this enough. When and if I ever need another heater, this would be the one I woulf buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley A.

customer_reviews.title: Defective from delivery
customer_reviews.text: The heat pump does not work. Waste of $$$. Have to now package and ship back or pay to have someone replace the defective control panel. Really unhappy. Steer clear. Updated to 3 stars for positive customer service response. Will report back.
customer_reviews.author: Turk721

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy to install as long as you have 240 near by.
customer_reviews.text: Am very happy with this heater. So far, it has extended our pool enjoyment by weeks. Love the fact that it will automatically turn on and off with the pool filter. So far it's working great and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rivera

customer_reviews.title: HOW AWESOME is that
customer_reviews.text: The man that built/invented this was available to advise the installer, HOW AWESOME is that. It works wonderfully, We have had a cooler than normal winter here in southwest Florida. Perfect timing!
customer_reviews.author: Linda McLendon

customer_reviews.title: 5 star heater and 5 star customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Great pool heater and customer service is unbelievable. The owner/inventor of the heater calls you personally if you have questions. He even calls on his days off. He has also helped me with other things regarding my pool besides the heater. I have contacted him several times and he is great. The pool heater is well worth the money and very inexpensive compared to other heaters. I highly recommend this heater to anyone that wants warm water in their pool. I have mine set at 90 degrees and I live in Chicago!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Christian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heat Pump! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased & installed heat pump in May. Have an Intex 18” x 52” AGP, live in MO and pool temp went from 65 to 85 in under 12 hours. Was able to get in the pool a month early and know I’ll be able to swim longer in the fall. I highly recommend this heater.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Delivery on time and unit was extremely well packaged. Installed myself with no problems. Easy plumbing and electrical installation. Extremely quiet. Weather to cold to run efficiently so will add to review when weather smartens up. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it heats the water
customer_reviews.text: unit came damaged by ups didn't notice till installed leaked water had to fix myself company seem like only 1 person works at the Fiber Pool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: If this unit is large enough for your pool or spa, buy it! I had a lot of problems with the hook-up and was frustrated. I called and actually got the owner. We talked several times over 4 or 5 days. At times I got upset with him but he was always very professional. Sent him pictures and my plumber had it hooked up backwards. In to out. This is a great company and product. The heater is wired amazing inside plus I have the keypad run a long "extended" way and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Pump is working excellent. Customer service was also excellent. Gentlemen took time after hours to help troubleshoot and look on Amazon to find a better pool pump to work with this heater.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly Falsetti

customer_reviews.title: Works great in FL winter - inside seems well planned and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great in FL winter - inside seems well planned and designed - compression fittings came with wrong height gaskets which would not seal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: seems great as long a the weather is warm/ when it work it works good
customer_reviews.text: seems to work great. I have a 9x18 intex heats it up 6 degrees in less than six hours. Not long enough to know energy jump for the bill. but my wife is ecstatic. addendum does not seem to heat the pool when temps go below 65 can't get above 79 all day run of 12 hours. does not seem to be able to get pool much above air temp. update: had unit serviced and it seemed to be very low on refrigerant. Tech support did not get along with the HVAC tech servicing the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Best deal to be found. The technical phone help service is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Tangaroa

customer_reviews.title: Even the UPS driver commented on how bad it was crated
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be built well, can't say much about their packaging, the cardboard box they had it wrapped in was tore up and some damage to one end of the unit which I beat back out and one of the gromitts was broken. Even the UPS driver commented on how bad it was crated, other than those items I will see how it preforms after I get it installed and running. I would have gave it five stars except for the condition it was in when I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Canton

customer_reviews.title: Above Geound Pool Heatet
customer_reviews.text: Better quality than their first version but customer service is virtually non existent. Heats our 18' round with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: We are now having nights in the 60's. I ...
customer_reviews.text: We are now having nights in the 60's. I have purchased a solar blanket and along with the heat pump the pool temperature is 90 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Roger C. Gillis

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: We just hocked this up to our pool and it freezes up not happy at all, not worth the cost, in the process of sending it back to purchase something else
customer_reviews.author: Becca

product_meta.title: FibroPool FH055 In Ground Swimming Pool Heater
feature_bullets: Quick disconnect piping, 1 1/2" pvc and 17 Amps power-220 volts
US Department of Energy top Energy Efficient System, 25 cents per hour

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars73 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
